title: Soraka silence not working when a champion comes out of stasis (i.e. Zhonyas or bard ult.)
body: Playing Soraka in one game I had 2 cases of this.  The first was with a kassadin that had zhonyas.  The second was a lux with a zhonyas.  The kass was able to rift walk right out of the silence and the lux was able to flash out of it.  Occurred on NA with the reaper soraka skin (if that has anything to do with it).

replies.body: Thanks for the report. This one's been a long running bug that we think we've just tracked down the cause of. A fix should be out in a patch or two, fingers crossed that addresses the issue.
Will this also solve the issue with Zilean Bombs not applying to someone who clicks a Thresh Lantern?

I don't believe so, from memory this fix was in Soraka's files specifically. I'll pass mention onto the designer who did the changes to Zilean's Q a while back though, so if he's able to identify what's going on there.
Isn't that just the frame for the "is in silence zone" check being too big, allowing people to flash out? Because I've seen it without need for stasis too.
It's common problem, her silence is ticking very slow, so champs have time between tics to react after Zhonya
